lead_paragraph: Greg Biffle held off the Busch brothers with a lap of 155.219 miles an hour at Dover (Del.) International Speedway to take the pole for Sunday’s Best Buy 400 and bolster his bid to drive the No. 16 Ford to his first victory of the season. Kurt Busch was second at 153.971, and Kyle Busch, the Sprint Cup points leader, was third at 153.767 on the one-mile concrete track. Jimmie Johnson and Jamie McMurray round out the top five for the race.
